myExercises.title: My Exercises
myExercises.activeProgramsDescription: Below you will find all your active exercise programs from completed assessments.
myExercises.endedProgramsDescription: Below you will find all programs you have already completed.

1.title: Neurodynamic exercises: what? why? when?
1.description: Have you ever heard of nerve flossing? If you have pain caused by nerve irritation or compression, nerve flossing can help.

2.title: Prevention of back pain at work
2.description: Tips for proper sitting, ergonomic workplace setup and exercises during the working day.

3.title: Stretching for a healthy spine
3.description: A simple stretching program that will help keep your spine healthy and flexible.

4.title: Exercise and nutrition
4.description: How proper nutrition contributes to better recovery and strengthening of back muscles.

5.title: Most common exercise mistakes
5.description: Avoid mistakes that can worsen back pain instead of relieving it.

6.title: Rehabilitation exercises after injury
6.description: Recommended procedures and exercises for rehabilitation after spinal injury or surgery.

welcome.title: Welcome to Pebee Therapist
welcome.subtitle: To access the questionnaire and personalized exercise programs, sign in to your account.

calendar.title: Exercise Calendar
calendar.text: Track your progress with our intuitive exercise calendar. You can see exactly when you exercised, how many days you've been active and what savings you've achieved. Motivate yourself with daily results and maintain a regular exercise routine.

programs.title: My Exercises and Programs
programs.text: Access personalized exercise programs tailored to your needs. Each exercise is designed for your type of pain and condition. Track active programs and stay motivated with a clear overview of your exercises.

assessment.title: Pain Assessment
assessment.text: Comprehensive assessment of your musculoskeletal pain using an interactive 3D model. Identify problem areas and get personalized recommendations. Our system analyzes symptoms and suggests an appropriate treatment plan.

exercisePlan.changeRequestAlert: Exercise change request has been sent.
exercisePlan.suitableQuestion: Is the exercise suitable for you?
exercisePlan.feedbackTitle: Why is the exercise not good?
exercisePlan.painQuestion: 1. Does the exercise cause you pain?
exercisePlan.changeQuestion: 2. Do you want to change this exercise?
exercisePlan.changeRequestInfo: After submitting this request, we will contact you regarding a suitable exercise replacement.
exercisePlan.replacementErrorDescription: Try contacting a physiotherapist or change the criteria.
exercisePlan.exerciseChangedDesc: The selected exercise has been replaced with a new one.
exercisePlan.markedGood: You marked the exercise as suitable.

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.text: These exercises serve only as general recommendations and do not replace a visit to a physiotherapist or doctor. If you experience increased pain, dizziness or any discomfort during exercise, immediately stop exercising and seek professional help.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy - Musculoskeletal Pain Questionnaire
privacy.intro: Your trust and the security of your data are key to us. Therefore, we would like to inform you how we process personal data that you provide to us through the musculoskeletal pain questionnaire.
privacy.email: Email address: We store and process only your email address. It serves so that we can send you the questionnaire results, possible recommendations or contact you with information about our services, if you have given consent to it.
privacy.health: Health status data: Information about your pain and health status that you enter in the questionnaire, we do not store and do not process. They serve exclusively for immediate evaluation and personalization of recommendations in real time. After the evaluation is completed, we do not keep this data in any way.
privacy.whyTitle: Why do we process email address?
whyList: To possibly send additional recommendations or educational content.
For communication in connection with the offer of our services, if you have expressed consent to receiving marketing information.
privacy.protectTitle: How do we protect your data?
privacy.protectText: We protect your email address with modern technical and organizational measures to prevent unauthorized access, alteration or loss of data.
privacy.rightsIntro: In accordance with GDPR, you have the right:
rightsList: to correct or delete personal data,
to withdraw consent to data processing at any time.
privacy.contact: To exercise your rights, you can contact us at privacy@example.com.
privacy.endText: Your privacy is our priority. We process only the necessary minimum of data and do not store or archive health information.

exercisePlanPage.title: Your Exercise Plan
exercisePlanPage.generalDescription: Personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you experience pain.
exercisePlanPage.specificDescription: Exercises specific for {{diagnosis}} in the {{painArea}} area. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you experience pain.
exercisePlanPage.gentleRotationalMovements: Gentle rotational movements to improve mobility in the thoracic area and reduce pain.
exercisePlanPage.notFoundDescription: We don't have specific exercises for your combination of diagnosis ({{diagnosis}}) and pain area ({{painArea}}). Please consult with a physiotherapist.
exercisePlanPage.generalNotAvailableDescription: You don't have enough assessments to create a general program or there are no exercises with defined importance available.

frozenShoulderPhase1.title: 0-3 weeks
frozenShoulderPhase1.description: Basic exercises for frozen shoulder aimed at reducing pain and increasing range of motion.

pendulumExercises.title: Pendulum exercises
pendulumExercises.description: Lean forward and start performing gentle pendulum movements to release tension in the shoulder. Slight movements within pain tolerance are sufficient.

isometricExternalRotation.title: Isometric external rotation of the shoulder
isometricExternalRotation.description: Approach the wall with your elbow bent at 90¬∞ angle against your body. Place a folded towel between the outer side of your palm and the wall. Keep your shoulders relaxed and down throughout -> make sure your shoulders don't rise to your ears during exercise. Then press the outer side of your palm against the wall with your elbow constantly pulled against your body. REPETITIONS: 6-8 seconds x 3-5 times in a row. 1-2x daily.

rotatorCuffRelease.title: Rotator cuff release
rotatorCuffRelease.description: Take a tennis ball and place it on your shoulder blade from behind. Lean against the wall and slowly massage the rotator cuff muscles. If you find a painful spot, stop at this point and press without movement for 30 seconds (sharp pain may radiate to the front of the shoulder).

shoulderHeating.title: Shoulder joint heating
shoulderHeating.description: Choose a heating pad or use a hair dryer. When using a hair dryer, ALWAYS PLACE A TOWEL on the skin and heat the towel! Start heating the shoulder from the front and later from the back -> heat for 10-15 minutes to completely warm the shoulder muscles. Always be careful not to burn your skin! REPETITIONS: 2x daily for 10-15min.

frozenShoulderPhase2.title: 4-6 weeks
frozenShoulderPhase2.description: Exercises to increase muscle strength and return to movement.

isometricShoulderPresses.title: Isometric shoulder presses
isometricShoulderPresses.description: Place your back against the wall and press your elbow into the wall. REPETITIONS: 6-8 seconds x 3 sets. Turn to face the wall, bend your elbow and press your palm (or hand in fist) into the wall. REPETITIONS: 6-8 seconds 3 sets.

wallPushUps.title: Wall push-ups
wallPushUps.description: Place your hands on the wall at chest level, slightly wider than shoulder width. Carefully approach the wall with your body straight and push away from the wall. Be careful not to lift your shoulders to your ears and respect the pain of your frozen shoulder. REPETITIONS: 10-12x 2 sets daily

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Grab the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate these 3 exercises or choose any of them. 
‚ûú WARNING: you must not feel strain in the trapezius muscles during these exercises! Always try to press your shoulder blades and shoulders down away from your ears so that the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between your shoulder blades more during the exercises, not your shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing your shoulders down. 
‚ûú REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 sets / 1x daily.

subacromialImpingement.title: Exercises for subacromial impingement syndrome
subacromialImpingement.description:
Exercises focused on improving space under the acromion and reducing pain.

These exercises help improve shoulder mechanics and reduce pressure on tendons.
Avoid overhead movements that worsen symptoms.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Grab the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate these 3 exercises or choose any of them. 
‚ûú WARNING: you must not feel strain in the trapezius muscles during these exercises! Always try to press your shoulder blades and shoulders down away from your ears so that the interscapular muscles work.

gentlePendulum.title: Gentle pendulum exercises
gentlePendulum.description: Lean forward and start performing gentle pendulum movements to release tension in the shoulder.

preExerciseHeating.title: Pre-exercise heating
preExerciseHeating.description: Heat the shoulder before exercise to improve circulation and muscle readiness.

rotatorCuffTear.title: Exercises for rotator cuff tear
rotatorCuffTear.description:
Specialized exercises for strengthening and rehabilitation after rotator cuff tear.

These exercises help restore shoulder function and prevent further injury.
Start with light exercises and gradually increase intensity.

isometricStrengthening.title: Isometric rotator cuff strengthening
isometricStrengthening.description: Gentle isometric exercises to strengthen the rotator cuff without excessive strain.

rotatorCuffMassage.title: Rotator cuff massage
rotatorCuffMassage.description: Gentle massage to improve circulation and release tension in the rotator cuff.

defaultNociceptive.title: General shoulder exercises - nociceptive pain
defaultNociceptive.description:
Basic exercises suitable for various types of nociceptive shoulder pain.

These exercises help improve overall shoulder function and reduce pain.
Perform them regularly but respect pain boundaries.

basicMobility.title: Basic shoulder mobility exercises
basicMobility.description: Gentle exercises to improve mobility in all directions.

basicStrengthening.title: Basic strengthening exercises
basicStrengthening.description: Light strengthening exercises for shoulder stabilization.

facetJointSyndrome.title: Exercises for Facet Joint Syndrome
facetJointSyndrome.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve mobility in the thoracic area and reduce pain.

phase1.title: 0-2 weeks
phase1.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve mobility in the thoracic area and reduce pain.

thoracicRotation.title: Thoracic spine rotation
thoracicRotation.description: Sit down slowly and place your hands behind your head. Slowly rotate to the sides, keeping your pelvis stationary. Repeat the movement 5-8 times in each direction. REPETITIONS: every day in the morning.

thoracicMassage.title: Thoracic spine massage with tennis ball
thoracicMassage.description: Place a tennis ball between your shoulder blades against the wall. Apply pressure and slowly massage the painful areas. If you find a painful point, stay at this spot and press without movement for 30 seconds. REPETITIONS: daily, especially during work breaks.

phase2.title: 3-5 weeks
phase2.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve mobility in the thoracic area and reduce pain.

thoracicExtension.title: Thoracic spine extension
thoracicExtension.description: Sit on a chair with a backrest. Place your hands behind your head and slowly extend your thoracic spine over the backrest. Hold the position for 5 seconds and return to the starting position. REPETITIONS: 10x / 2 sets / daily.

thoracicMobilization.title: Thoracic spine mobilization
thoracicMobilization.description: Lie on your side with your knees bent. Place your upper hand behind your head and slowly rotate your torso while keeping your knees on the ground. REPETITIONS: 8-10x each side / 2 sets / daily.

defaultNociceptive.title: General middle back exercises - nociceptive pain
defaultNociceptive.description:
Basic exercises suitable for various types of nociceptive middle back pain.

These exercises help improve overall thoracic spine function and reduce pain.
Perform them regularly but respect pain boundaries.

basicMobility.title: Basic thoracic mobility exercises
basicMobility.description: Gentle exercises to improve mobility in all directions.

basicStrengthening.title: Basic strengthening exercises
basicStrengthening.description: Light strengthening exercises for thoracic spine stabilization.

discHerniation.title: Exercises for Disc Herniation
discHerniation.description: Specialized exercises for managing disc herniation and promoting healing.

phase1.title: 0-2 weeks
phase1.description: Initial exercises focused on pain relief and gentle movement.

pelvicTilts.title: Pelvic tilts
pelvicTilts.description: Lie on your back with knees bent. Gently tilt your pelvis to flatten your lower back against the floor. Hold for 5 seconds. REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 sets / daily.

kneeToChest.title: Knee to chest stretch
kneeToChest.description: Lie on your back and gently pull one knee toward your chest. Hold for 20-30 seconds, then switch legs. REPETITIONS: 3x each leg / 2 sets / daily.

facetJointSyndrome.title: Exercises for Lower Back Facet Joint Syndrome
facetJointSyndrome.description: Exercises to improve mobility and reduce pain in facet joints.

phase1.title: 0-2 weeks
phase1.description: Gentle exercises to reduce pain and inflammation.

catCow.title: Cat-cow stretch
catCow.description: Start on hands and knees. Arch your back (cow) then round it (cat). Move slowly and smoothly. REPETITIONS: 10x / 2 sets / daily.

defaultNociceptive.title: General lower back exercises - nociceptive pain
defaultNociceptive.description: Basic exercises suitable for various types of nociceptive lower back pain.

basicMobility.title: Basic lower back mobility
basicMobility.description: Gentle mobility exercises for the lumbar spine.

cervicalRadiculopathy.title: Exercises for Cervical Radiculopathy
cervicalRadiculopathy.description: Specialized exercises for managing nerve-related neck pain.

phase1.title: 0-2 weeks
phase1.description: Gentle exercises to reduce nerve irritation.

neckRetraction.title: Neck retraction
neckRetraction.description: Gently pull your chin back to create a double chin. Hold for 5 seconds. REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 sets / daily.

defaultNociceptive.title: General neck exercises - nociceptive pain
defaultNociceptive.description: Basic exercises suitable for various types of nociceptive neck pain.

basicMobility.title: Basic neck mobility
basicMobility.description: Gentle mobility exercises for the cervical spine.

defaultNeuropathic.title: Shoulder exercises - neuropathic pain
defaultNeuropathic.description: Specialized exercises for nerve-related shoulder pain.

nerveGliding.title: Nerve gliding exercises
nerveGliding.description: Gentle movements to improve nerve mobility and reduce symptoms.

defaultCentral.title: Shoulder exercises - central sensitization
defaultCentral.description: Gentle exercises adapted for central sensitization pain.

gentleMovement.title: Gentle movement therapy
gentleMovement.description: Very gentle movements to gradually desensitize the nervous system.
